nodes.text: Filice Ginzork was a female Arhan. She married Peert Ginzork sometime around 0 BBY and was part of the private security organization "The Shield." She was a skilled slicer and was secretly a member of the Rebel Alliance.

Around 0 BBY, Filice Ginzork married Peert Ginzork. She worked as a private security specialist for The Shield, a group that protected corporate couriers and executives and had recently branched into counter-espionage. She was also secretly a member of the Rebel Alliance, a fact that was hidden from both the Galactic Empire and the corporations that hired her and her company.
Ginzork was a female Arhan who had a very thin and frail body and very long facial features.

Ginzork was a talented slicer who was highly skilled at computer programming and repair. She was also trained in a variety of skills useful to an operative such as investigation, persuasion, stealth, urban survival, and basic forms of combat.

Ginzork carried a blaster pistol, a comlink, a recording rod a datapad, and a portable computer. She also carried macrobinoculars, a medpac, a chronometer, four computer spikes, a restraining bolt, a lectroticker, a lockpick, and a sabacc cheater chip.

Filice Ginzork was designed by Rick Olshak for Cracken's Rebel Operatives, a supplement for the Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game that was published by West End Games in 1994. She was illustrated by Mike Vilardi.
